title: China Urges Diplomatic Talks, Warns of Countermeasures to Trump's Tariff Threat
snippets: China signaled Sunday that it would not back down in the face of a 100% tariff threat from President Donald Trump, urging the U.S. to resolve differences through negotiations instead of threats.
Beijing says it could introduce "countermeasures" if the US President imposes an an additional 100% tariff on Chinese imports.
Beijing says it will not back down in the face of threats, urging the US to resolve differences through negotiations.

Investors brace for another bout of trade war turmoil as Beijing says it will act if US president fails to back down Beijing has told the US it will retaliate if Donald Trump fails to back down on his threat to impose 100% tariffs on Chinese imports as investors brace for another bout of trade war t
It was China's first official comment on Trump's threat to jack up the tax on imports from China by Nov. 1 in response to new Chinese restrictions on the export of rare earths.
titles: China vows to stand firm against Trump's 100% tariff threat
China accuses US of 'double standards' over tariff threat
China slams Trump’s 100 percent tariff threat, defends rare earth curbs
China warns US of retaliation over Trump’s 100% tariffs threat
China says it won’t back down from Trump’s 100 per cent tariff threat
summary: China has responded to President Trump's threat of imposing a 100% tariff on Chinese imports by urging the U.S. to seek resolution through negotiation, not threats. Beijing has warned it will introduce "countermeasures" if such tariffs are implemented. The Commerce Ministry emphasized China's consistent stance on seeking diplomatic solutions over conflict.

title: Penn State Fires James Franklin After Third Straight Loss, Names Interim Coach
snippets: Penn State has fired longtime coach James Franklin, who is owed more than $49 million.
After two shocking losses, Penn State is looking for a new coach. The job quickly becomes the best in this cycle.
Franklin's Lions dropped to 0-3 in Big Ten play with Saturday's loss to Northwestern
Penn State Fires Coach James Franklin After Third Straight Loss Sports Illustrated

STATE COLLEGE, Pa. — James Franklin is out at Penn State. The school fired the longtime head coach on Sunday, less than 24 hours after a 22-21 home loss to Northwestern all but ended whatever remote chance the pre-season No. 2 team had of reaching the College Football Playoff. Terry Smith will serve as the interim head coach for the rest of the season for the Nittany Lions (3-3, 0-3 Big Ten), who began the year with hopes of winning the national title only to have those hopes evaporate by early October with three consecutive losses, each one more stinging than the last. Penn State, which...
titles: Penn State fires Franklin amid midseason free fall
Penn State fires James Franklin: Top candidates, transfers and recruits
Penn State fires James Franklin: Longtime coach out amid unfathomable slide from preseason CFP contender
Penn State Fires Coach James Franklin After Third Straight Loss - Sports Illustrated
Penn State fires head coach James Franklin amid disastrous start to season
summary: Penn State has terminated James Franklin as head coach following a third consecutive loss, leaving the team at 3-3 overall and 0-3 in Big Ten play. This decision comes after a 22-21 defeat to Northwestern, significantly diminishing their pre-season hopes for a College Football Playoff spot. Franklin, who had a contract exceeding $49 million, will be replaced by interim head coach Terry Smith for the remainder of the season.

title: Four Dead, 20 Injured in South Carolina Bar Shooting
snippets: A mass shooting at a crowded bar on an idyllic South Carolina island has left four people dead and at least 20 injured, officials say.
Four people were killed and at least 20 injured, several critically, after a shooting at a crowded bar in South Carolina on Sunday.

Shooting occurred early Sunday at Willie’s Bar and Grill on idyllic St Helena island A mass shooting at a crowded bar on an idyllic South Carolina island has left four people dead and at least 20 injured, officials say. The shooting occurred early Sunday at Willie’s Bar and Grill on St Helena island

BEAUFORT, S.C. (AP) — A mass shooting at a crowded bar on an idyllic South Carolina island has left four people dead and at least 20 injured, officials said. The shooting occurred early Sunday at Willie’s Bar and Grill on St. Helena Island, officials said. A large crowd was at the scene when sheriff
titles: 4 killed and 20 more injured in shooting at a bar in South Carolina, sheriff says
Shooting at crowded South Carolina bar leaves 4 dead
South Carolina bar shooting leaves four people dead and 20 injured, officials say
4 people were killed and 20 more were injured in a shooting at a bar in South Carolina, sheriff says
summary: A mass shooting at Willie’s Bar and Grill on St. Helena Island, South Carolina, early Sunday, resulted in four deaths and at least 20 injuries. The incident took place just before 1 a.m. in a crowded bar, according to the sheriff's office.

The president of Madagascar acknowledged an ongoing illegal and forceful attempt to seize power. This development marks a significant escalation in the country's political crisis.

title: Xander Schauffele Wins at Baycurrent Classic, His First in 15 Months
snippets: A long, arduous year for the No. 4 golfer in the world was finally awarded during the second FedEx Cup Fall tournament
Competing in Japan, where his family roots run deep, Schauffele returned to the winner's circle for the first time in 15 months.
Highlights of day four of the Baycurrent Classic at Yokohoma Country Club.
This may not have been Xander Schauffele’s most prestigious tournament victory, but it should be the American’s most memorable.

Schauffele earns memorable win at Baycurrent Classic in Japan
summary: Xander Schauffele, the No. 4 golfer in the world, won his first tournament in 15 months at the Baycurrent Classic in Yokohama, Japan. This victory, coming after a challenging year, is significant for Schauffele due to his family connections to Japan. The win at Yokohama Country Club marks a memorable moment in his career, despite not being his most prestigious title.

title: Afghanistan Kills 58 Pakistani Soldiers in Border Clash
snippets: Afghanistan said Sunday it killed 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations, in response to what it called repeated violations of its territory and airspace.
The attacks came days after Pakistan was accused of bombing a market inside Afghanistan.
These were the updates about the border fighting between Afghan and Pakistani forces on Sunday, October 12, 2025.
Afghanistan’s Taliban government and Pakistan traded fire overnight, marking one of the deadliest border clashes since the fall of Kabul in 2021.
titles: Afghanistan says it has killed 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations

Updates: Afghanistan’s Taliban, Pakistan say border clashes killed dozens
Afghanistan and Pakistan claim to kill dozens of soldiers in border clash
summary: Afghanistan reported killing 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations, citing repeated territorial and airspace violations. The Taliban government acknowledged the loss of nine Afghan soldiers. Pakistan claimed to have seized border posts in the conflict.

title: Blue Jays Drop Bichette for ALCS, Add Scherzer and Bassitt Against Mariners
snippets: Blue Jays shortstop Bo Bichette will not return to the Toronto lineup for the American League Championship Series against Seattle.

Bo Bichette is not on the Toronto Blue Jays’ roster for the American League Championship Series, with Max Scherzer and Chris Bassitt the only two additions for the club’s clash with the Seattle Mariners.

summary: The Toronto Blue Jays have excluded shortstop Bo Bichette from their American League Championship Series roster due to his inactivity since early September. Instead, they've added pitchers Max Scherzer and Chris Bassitt for their series against the Seattle Mariners, who will see the return of Bryan Woo.

title: Cardinals' Marvin Harrison Jr. Out with Concussion Against Colts
snippets: Cardinals wide receiver Marvin Harrison Jr. was ruled out against the Colts with a concussion.
Ward was one of two Colts injured in pregame warmups

The Arizona Cardinals have lost their top wideout. Marvin Harrison Jr. has been ruled out for the remainder of the game vs. the Colts with a concussion, the team announced on Sunday. Harrison Jr. banged his head on the turf after being tackled with around four minutes left in the second quarter. He immediately went to the locker room with trainers. Arizona selected Harrison Jr. with the fourth-overall pick in the 2024 draft. The 23-year-old posted 65 catches for 885 yards and eight touchdowns in his rookie season. Through five games this year, Harrison Jr. has 20 grabs for 306 yards and two...
titles: Cards WR Harrison suffers concussion, ruled out
Colts CB Charvarius Ward suffers concussion in warmups after colliding with teammate
Cardinals’ Marvin Harrison Jr. ruled out with concussion
summary: Marvin Harrison Jr., wide receiver for the Arizona Cardinals, was ruled out for the remainder of the game against the Colts due to a concussion. This occurred after he hit his head on the turf in the second quarter. Harrison Jr., a top pick in the 2024 draft, has contributed significantly this season with 20 receptions and two touchdowns.

title: Israel to Free Gaza Hostages Monday; Plans Release of 2,000 Palestinians
snippets: Once Israel confirms all 20 living captives in Israeli territory, it says it will start releasing Palestinian prisoners.

Government says it is also preparing for release of 2,000 Palestinian detainees in crucial next phase of ceasefire deal Ceasefire live: Netanyahu says Israel is ready for ‘immediate’ release of hostages The Israeli government says it expects all living hostages held in Gaza to be released on Monday

CAIRO (AP) — Israel said Sunday that it expected all living hostages held in Gaza to be released Monday in its breakthrough ceasefire deal with Hamas, as Palestinians awaited the release of hundreds of prisoners held in Israel and a surge of aid into the famine-stricken territory. “In a few hours, w
titles: Israel expects to receive all living captives from Gaza on Monday
Israel expects all 20 living hostages to be freed from Gaza on Monday morning
Israel expects hostages to be freed from Gaza ‘in a few hours’ as ceasefire holds
summary: Israel has announced that it expects the release of all living hostages from Gaza on Monday as part of a ceasefire deal with Hamas. Following this, Israel will start releasing Palestinian prisoners, with plans to release 2,000 detainees in a subsequent phase. This development comes as Palestinians anticipate the release of hundreds of prisoners and an influx of aid into famine-affected areas.

title: Penn State Fires James Franklin Over QB Development, Faces Financial Fallout

The financial implications of this decision include a significant payout to Franklin as detailed by Sports Illustrated, raising questions about the potential benefits of this move for other programs, including Notre Dame.

title: Mark Sanchez Released, Faces Felony Charge After Stabbing Incident
snippets: Mark Sanchez was released from an Indianapolis hospital on Sunday and immediately booked on a felony charge stemming from an altercation, according to police.

Following his release from jail, Sanchez, now a Fox analyst, stated he is concentrating on his recovery. The incident involved a stabbing, resulting in significant injuries to another man. Sanchez has since been released and has commented on his recovery process.

title: Israel Begins Military Withdrawal, Prepares for Hostage Release Ahead of Summit

summary: Israel's military has begun withdrawing ahead of a peace summit in Egypt, as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announces readiness for the immediate reception of all Gaza hostages. Forty-eight Israeli hostages are set to be released on Monday, with nearly 2,000 Palestinian detainees to follow. This comes as aid trucks enter Gaza, marking a significant step towards a potential lasting peace between Israel and Hamas.

title: Canucks' Tyler Myers Fined $2,500 for Slashing Oilers' McDavid

title: NHL Roundup: Canadiens Edge Blackhawks, Bruins Stay Undefeated
snippets: After a loss in Toronto, and an impressive win in Detroit, the Montreal Canadiens wrapped up in Chicago after three games in four nights on the road.
Kaiden Guhle scored with 15.7 seconds left, and the Montreal Canadiens spoiled Chicago’s home opener with a 3-2 NHL victory over the Blackhawks on Saturday night.
Cole Caufield recorded a goal and an assist, Juraj Slafkovsky buried the game-winner with just 15 seconds remaining, and the Montreal Canadiens took a 3-2 win over the Chicago Blackhawks.

The Florida Panthers triumphed 6-2 against the Ottawa Senators, and the New Jersey Devils won 5-3 over the Tampa Bay Lightning. The Washington Capitals beat the New York Islanders 4-2, the Boston Bruins improved to 3-0 with a 3-1 win against the Buffalo Sabres, and the New York Rangers dominated the Penguins 6-1. title: Mexico Floods and Landslides Kill 41; Troops Deployed for Relief
snippets: Authorities said the death toll had risen to at least 41 amid severe flooding and landslides in the south east. Thousands of troops have been deployed to help with disaster efforts.
The downpours also damaged thousands of homes and cut off power to entire towns. More rain was expected this weekend.
Floods caused by torrential rains have killed at least 41 people in Mexico in recent days and left behind a trail of destruction, the government said Saturday.
titles: Mexico: Floods and landslides claim dozens of lives
Heavy Rain, Floods and Landslides in Mexico Kill at Least 41
At least 41 dead in Mexico floods
summary: Severe flooding and landslides in southeast Mexico have resulted in at least 41 deaths, with thousands of troops deployed for disaster relief. The heavy rains damaged homes and disrupted power, with more rain forecasted.

A 43-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder following the incident, which was reported around 7:30 am on Sunday. Police have urged the public not to speculate as the investigation continues. The woman remains in custody.

title: Spratly Collision Escalates China-Philippines Tensions
snippets: Manila has decried the incident as a "clear threat" from China, while Beijing insists the Philippines' vessels bear "full responsibility" for the collision in the long-disputed naval region.
Philippines Says Chinese Ship Rammed Government Vessel at Sea Bloomberg.com
titles: Philippines says China rammed their ship in South China Sea
Philippines Says Chinese Ship Rammed Government Vessel at Sea - Bloomberg.com
summary: A collision in the disputed Spratly archipelago has escalated tensions between China and the Philippines. Beijing claims Manila's vessel bore "full responsibility," citing "ignored warnings," while Manila accuses a Chinese ship of deliberately ramming its government vessel, calling it a "clear threat." Both nations hold opposing views on the incident in the contested South China Sea region.
